item.title: 分析师称大选结果公布后澳大利亚资产或将反弹
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴尼塞（Anthony Albanese）连任后，人们预期他的政策将保持连续性，因此澳大利亚的股票和货币可能会出现缓解性反弹。【原文：Australia’s shares and currency may post a relief rally on expectations of policy continuity under Prime Minister Anthony Albanese after his re-election for a second term.】

item.title: 欧佩克+供应激增威胁全球市场，石油价格下挫
item.description: 欧佩克+同意再次大幅增产，在需求受到贸易战拖累的情况下增加供应，石油因全球供应过剩的担忧而下跌。【原文：Oil buckled on concerns of a global glut after OPEC+ agreed to another bumper output increase, adding to supply at a time when demand is challenged by the drag from the trade war.】

item.title: 美元汇率下跌引发亚洲各国货币波动
item.description: 在美元疲软的推动下，亚洲货币正取得罕见的超高收益，并引发央行干预，以抑制过高的涨幅。【原文：Asian currencies turbocharged by dollar weakness are attaining rarely seen superlatives and triggering central bank intervention to curb excessive gains.】

item.title: 贸易担忧减退，期权交易商押注澳元跑赢基元
item.description: 投资者正在买入澳元货币期权，打赌随着全球贸易紧张局势的缓解，澳元的表现将优于新西兰元。【原文：Investors are buying currency options on the Australian dollar, wagering it will outperform its New Zealand counterpart as global trade tensions ease.】

item.title: 加藤称不会在贸易谈判中出售美国国债
item.description: 日本财务大臣加藤胜信（Katsunobu Kato）表示，他不会在与华盛顿的贸易谈判中利用出售日本持有的美国国债。【原文：Japan’s Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato said he won’t use the sale of the country’s US Treasury holdings in its trade negotiations with Washington.】

item.title: 亿万富翁和首席执行官齐聚洛杉矶，为米尔肯呐喊助威
item.description:
这座美国第二大城市首当其冲地受到气候、住房和政治挑战的影响，关税和驱逐出境可能带来更多痛苦。【原文：

The second-largest US city is bearing the brunt of climate, housing and political challenges, with tariffs and deportations threatening more pain.

】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 油价处于 2021 年的水平。铜被大量运往美国，使得亚洲和伦敦的库存处于历史最低水平。此外，全球天气炎热干燥，这对美国农民来说是件好事，但对欧洲农民来说就不是那么回事了。【原文：Oil prices are at 2021 levels. Copper is rushing to the US, leaving Asian and London inventories at historically low levels. And, boy is it hot and dry around the world — which is good for US farmers but not so much for those in Europe.】

item.title: 精品咨询公司 Tidal Partners 聘请科技界资深人士 Bill Shope
item.description: 资深技术分析师和企业家比尔-肖普（Bill Shope）在高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Veteran technology analyst and entrepreneur Bill Shope is joining Tidal Partners after 18 years at banks including Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 巴菲特宣布 5,500,000% 的收益率告一段落，首席执行官们为他庆祝
item.description: 苹果公司的蒂姆-库克称他鼓舞人心。美国银行的布莱恩-莫伊尼汉（Brian Moynihan）赞扬了他对生活和商业的教诲。摩根大通的杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）说他是 "美国资本主义的一切优点"。【原文：Apple’s Tim Cook called him inspiring. Bank of America’s Brian Moynihan praised his lessons on life and business. JPMorgan’s Jamie Dimon said he’s “everything that is good about American capitalism.”】

item.title: 特朗普呼吁降息，债券交易员转向鲍威尔一边
item.description: 在周五早些时候公布 4 月份就业报告 15 分钟后，唐纳德-特朗普总统抓住就业增长出人意料地强劲这一契机，加大了对美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔的施压力度，称没有理由暂缓降息。【原文：Fifteen minutes after the April employment report hit early Friday, President Donald Trump seized on the surprisingly strong job growth to ratchet up his pressure on Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, saying there was no reason to hold off on cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 马尔代夫计划投资 88 亿美元建设金融中心，卡塔尔王室提供支持
item.description: 马尔代夫政府表示，在该国寻求解决债务危机之际，它计划在总部位于迪拜的 MBS Global Investments 公司的支持下建立一个价值 88 亿美元的金融中心。【原文：The government of Maldives said it plans to build an $8.8 billion financial hub backed by Dubai-based MBS Global Investments as the country seeks to address a debt crisis.】

item.title: 贸易混乱是特朗普计划的一部分，是鲍威尔的噩梦
item.description: 最近，芝加哥地区零售商吉姆-图勒（Jim Tuchler）和美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）有很多共同点。【原文：Jim Tuchler, a Chicago-area retailer, and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell have a lot in common these days.】

item.title: 巴菲特将巨额现金和诸多问题交给继任者
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）选择在第 60 次股东大会的最后一分钟宣布了一个期待已久的消息，而这个消息对于他的粉丝、他的大多数董事会成员甚至他的继任者来说，仍然是完全出乎意料的。【原文：Warren Buffett picked the final minute of his 60th shareholder meeting to drop a long-awaited announcement that was still completely surprising for his fans, most of his board and even his successor.】

item.title: 特朗普表示愿意 "在某个时候 "降低对华关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统说，他愿意在某个时候降低对中国的关税，因为现在的征税太高，世界上最大的两个经济体基本上已经停止了相互之间的业务往来。【原文：President Donald Trump said he is willing to lower tariffs on China at some point because the levies now are so high that the world’s two largest economies have essentially stopped doing business with each other.】

item.title: 纽瓦克机场漏洞百出，美国准备全面整顿空中交通
item.description: 由于现有系统存在漏洞，美国联合航空公司（United Airlines Holdings Inc.【原文：The Trump administration’s plan to modernize the aging US air traffic-control system has gained fresh urgency after vulnerabilities with the existing system pushed United Airlines Holdings Inc. to cut flights at the second-busiest hub serving New York City.】

item.title: 特朗普表示，如有必要，他将再次延长 TikTok 的使用期限
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，如果需要达成交易，他将再次延长社交视频平台 TikTok 出售给美国所有者的最后期限。【原文：President Donald Trump said he would give social-video platform TikTok another extension of a deadline to sell to a US owner if it was needed to reach a deal.】

item.title: 热门对冲基金期权交易随市场动荡而调整
item.description: 对于对冲基金来说，去年流行的指数分散交易已逐渐转变为更有针对性的策略。【原文：For hedge funds, last year’s popular index dispersion trade has increasingly morphed into more focused strategies.】

item.title: 阿联酋为在校学生推出人工智能技术，推动行业前沿发展
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国今年将在公立学校课程中引入人工智能，这个海湾国家正努力成为人工智能发展的地区强国。【原文：The United Arab Emirates will introduce artificial intelligence to the public school curriculum this year, as the Gulf country vies to become a regional powerhouse for AI development.】

item.title: 大型科技公司业绩打破股市 "最坏情况 "的担忧
item.description: 美国科技巨头上周发布的财报显示，面对唐纳德-特朗普总统不断变化的贸易政策，这些公司的前景依然强劲，这让主导 S&P 500 指数的美国科技巨头的投资者松了一口气。【原文：Investors in the US technology behemoths that dominate the S&P 500 Index are breathing a sigh of relief as last week’s earnings reports from the group show their outlooks remain mostly strong in the face of President Donald Trump’s shifting trade policies.】

item.title: 关税动荡后，全球风险最高的债券吸引交易者回归
item.description: 投资者又开始涉足一些风险最高的新兴市场债券，抢购因关税引发的波动而变得廉价的高收益政府债券。【原文：Investors are dipping their toes back into some of the riskiest emerging-market bonds, snapping up high-yield government debt that has been made cheap by tariff-induced volatility.】

item.title: 法国总理称改革计划可能需要全民公决
item.description: 法国总理弗朗索瓦-巴伊鲁说，他打算提出一项计划，以减少该国的债务负担，并促进欧元区第二大经济体的生产。【原文：French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou said he intends to present a plan to reduce the country’s debt pile and boost production in the euro area’s second-biggest economy, and didn’t rule out a referendum to secure public backing for the reforms.】

item.title: 沙特警告 "欧佩克+"欺骗者，除非他们服从命令，否则将获得更多供应
item.description: 与会代表表示，欧佩克+领导人沙特阿拉伯已警告产量过剩的成员国，除非它们改善履约情况，否则该集团将进一步增加供应量。【原文：OPEC+ leader Saudi Arabia has warned overproducing members the group will make further supply increases unless they improve compliance, delegates said.】

item.title: 沙特医院运营商 SMC 将在当地首次公开募股中出售 30% 的股份
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯医院运营商专业医疗公司（Specialized Medical Co.【原文：Saudi Arabian hospital operator Specialized Medical Co. unveiled plans for an initial public offering in Riyadh, a further sign that firms across the kingdom are pressing ahead with listings despite global market volatility.】

item.title: 桑切斯正在寻找西班牙最大停电事件的罪魁祸首
item.description: 最终，电灯在半天后恢复了亮度，但人们对造成欧洲记忆中最严重停电事件之一的原因却没有答案。【原文：In the end, the lights came back after half a day but the answers didn’t for what caused one of Europe’s worst outages in living memory.】

item.title: 苏丹军队称 RSF 首次使用无人机攻击重要港口
item.description: 苏丹军队称，其对手使用无人机袭击了苏丹港的一个军事空军基地和其他地点，这是两年内战中对这座红海城市的首次明显袭击。【原文：Sudan’s army said its opponents used drones to strike a military airbase and other locations in Port Sudan, the first apparent attacks of that kind on the Red Sea city in the two-year civil war.】

item.title: 阿提哈德将超大奢华挤进最小飞机
item.description: 十年前，阿提哈德航空公司接收了第一架空客 SE A380 喷气式客机，当时该公司在这架巨型双层客机的前部布置了一个名副其实的豪华游乐场，称为 "官邸"（Residence），有三个房间，包括一张双人床、起居室和淋浴间；所有这些都有私人管家随侍左右。【原文：When Etihad Airways received its first Airbus SE A380 jets a good decade ago, the airline furnished the front of the giant double decker with a veritable luxury playground it called the Residence, a three-room layout featuring a double bed, living area and shower cubicle — all with a personal butler on hand.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克赢得在德克萨斯州星际基地建立自己城市的投票
item.description: 得克萨斯州南部的选民给埃隆-马斯克带来了决定性的胜利，以压倒性多数通过了一项投票措施，将得克萨斯州星堡市（Starbase）建成自己的城市。【原文：Voters in South Texas delivered Elon Musk a decisive victory, overwhelmingly approving a ballot measure to establish Starbase, Texas, as its own city.】

item.title: 玻利维亚参议院议长罗德里格斯计划竞选总统
item.description: 玻利维亚参议院议长安德罗尼科-罗德里格斯（Andronico Rodriguez）表示，他将在八月的大选中竞选总统，成为最有可能拉拢左翼选民的候选人。【原文：Bolivia’s Senate President Andronico Rodriguez said he will run for president in the August election, emerging as perhaps the most likely candidate to rally left-wing voters.】

item.title: 中国提前分红有助于缓解人民币汇率波动
item.description: 在香港上市的中国公司正将股息支付提前至第二季度，此举可能会平抑人民币在年内的波动。【原文：Chinese companies listed in Hong Kong are bringing forward dividend payments to the second quarter, a move that may smooth out yuan volatility over the year.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔即将挑战特朗普并保持利率稳定
item.description: 美联储的处境越来越尴尬。【原文：Things are getting awkward for the Federal Reserve.】
